title: Here's a diverse reading list of 20 articles up to 2020 that cover various methods in machine reasoning within the field of natural language processing (NLP
**"Sequence to Sequence Learning with Neural Networks"** - Ilya Sutskever, Oriol Vinyals, Quoc V
Introduces the sequence-to-sequence framework, which has been foundational for many probabilistic NLP models

author.literal: **"Attention Is All You Need"** - Ashish Vaswani, Noam Shazeer, Niki Parmar, Jakob Uszkoreit, Llion Jones, Aidan N. Gomez, Łukasz Kaiser

title: Illia Polosukhin
Presents the Transformer model, revolutionizing probabilistic approaches in NLP
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Jacob Devlin
Describes BERT, a model that uses probabilistic methods for pre-training on large text corpora
**"Variational Inference: A Review for Statisticians"**
A comprehensive review of variational inference, a key probabilistic method used in NLP
**"A Neural Probabilistic Language Model"** - Yoshua Bengio, Réjean Ducharme
One of the pioneering works in neural probabilistic language modeling
**"WordNet: An Electronic Lexical Database"** - Christiane Fellbaum
Discusses WordNet, a large lexical database that has been widely used in symbolic NLP
**"A Survey of Knowledge Representation in Natural Language Processing"**
Provides an overview of symbolic knowledge representation techniques in NLP
**"Learning Semantic Parsers: An Important but Under-studied Problem"**
Explores methods for learning semantic parsers, which are crucial for symbolic reasoning in NLP
**"Towards a Theory of Natural Language Interfaces to Databases"**
Early work on symbolic methods for interfacing natural language with databases
**"A Survey of Symbolic Methods in Natural Language Processing"**
A comprehensive survey of symbolic methods in NLP
**"Neural-Symbolic Learning and Reasoning: A Survey and Interpretation"**
Discusses the integration of neural and symbolic methods for reasoning
**"Integrating Symbolic and Neural Approaches: A Survey"** - Pascal Hitzler, Anthony G
A survey on the integration of symbolic and neural approaches in AI, including NLP

author.literal: **"Neural-Symbolic Cognitive Reasoning"** - Artur S. d'Avila Garcez, Krysia Broda, Dov M. Gabbay

title: Explores the combination of neural networks and symbolic reasoning
**"Learning to Reason: End-to-End Module Networks for Visual Question Answering"** - Ronghang Hu
note: Jacob Andreas, Trevor Darrell, Kate Saenko, Marcus Rohrbach (2017

title: Introduces a hybrid approach for reasoning in visual question answering, relevant for NLP
**"Neural-Symbolic Learning and Reasoning: Contributions and Challenges"**
Discusses recent contributions and challenges in neural-symbolic learning and reasoning
**"Reinforcement Learning for Dialogue Generation"**
note: Jiwei Li, Will Monroe, Alan Ritter, Michel Galley, Jianfeng Gao, Dan Jurafsky (2016

title: Explores reinforcement learning methods for dialogue generation in NLP
**"Deep Reinforcement Learning for Dialogue Generation"**
note: Jiwei Li, Will Monroe, Tianlin Shi, Sébastien Jean, Alan Ritter, Dan Jurafsky (2017

title: Further investigates the application of deep reinforcement learning in NLP
**"Commonsense Knowledge Base Completion"** - Antoine Bosselut
note: Hannah Rashkin, Maarten Sap, Chaitanya Malaviya, Asli Celikyilmaz, Yejin Choi (2019

title: Discusses methods for completing commonsense knowledge bases, which are essential for reasoning
**"A Survey on Knowledge Graphs: Representation, Acquisition, and Applications"**
Provides a comprehensive survey on knowledge graphs, which are crucial for reasoning in NLP
**"Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI): Concepts, Taxonomies, Opportunities and Challenges toward Responsible AI"** - Adadi
Discusses explainable AI, which is important for understanding and reasoning in NLP systems
These articles should provide a solid foundation in understanding the various methods and approaches to machine reasoning in NLP up to
